Package Explorer

Class LoreHandler

java.lang.Object
Explorer.LoreHandler
public class LoreHandler
extends java.lang.Object
this class reads the lore config files and turns them into LoreShort class instances it saves all of these instances to a list it can be called from outside, takes in specifications for the type of lore you want and returns the fitting loreshort every time a new loreshort is requested, the config file is read again: allows for chaning of config during runtime.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.lang.String defaultLore
    default String that is used when no matching LoreShort is found for the required entity.

    reference to the main class of the mod, used for writing to debug file
    java.util.List<LoreShort> loreList
    stores the LoreShorts.
    (package private) java.lang.String path
    path to in-install config file.

    Reads the loreconfig.json from the game install if the file does not exist, it will create a config from the hardcoded LoreHolder.json from the jar and read that one.

  • Method Details

    • ReadFile

      public void ReadFile​(java.lang.String path)
      Reads the loreconfig.json from the game install if the file does not exist, it will create a config from the hardcoded LoreHolder.json from the jar and read that one. will attempt to create a new config 2 times before stopping.
      Parameters:
      path - the file path in the game install from where to read the lore config file

    • ReadFile

      public void ReadFile()
      ReadFile overload that does not require a specific path. will use the default path instead.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Debug method, not used in built code.
      Parameters:
      args -

    • WriteFile

      public void WriteFile()
      Empty method

    • GetLoreText

      public java.lang.String GetLoreText​(int factionID, int entityType)
      Will search through all available Loreshorts, create a list fitting the specified faction and entitytype and choose one randomly.
      Parameters:
      factionID - Vanilla faction ID (int). Intended to be trading guild, traders, pirates, derelict etc.
      entityType - Entity type, unused parameter atm. -1 as input will ignore entityType.
      Returns:
      randomly selected, fitting LoreShort. Default Loreshort if no matches were found.

    • GetLoreText

      public java.lang.String GetLoreText​(int factionID)
      GetLoreText Overload that will use any entityType and only takes a faction ID
      Parameters:
      factionID -
      Returns:
